variantrule.name: New Languages
entries: {@b Umbral} is the language of the shadow elves, a corrupted dialect of Elvish, and spoken by most creatures of shadow. Those who speak it can gain a +1 to one Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check 1/day.

{@b Void Speech} is the language of the Outer Darkness in the Midgard campaign setting, spoken by vile things that are malevolent towards humans and their allies, and who seek to bring about the ruinous apocalypse of the dark gods. Substitute any ancient language with an evil reputation if you are using another setting.

disease.name: Iumenta Pox
entries: It takes {@dice 1d4} days for iumenta pox's symptoms to appear in an infected humanoid. A creature with iumenta pox has trouble breathing, and its skin erupts with painful green boils that ooze pus. As the disease progresses, these pustules turn black.

At the end of each long rest, an infected creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The creature's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0. When an infected creature dies, its corpse rises as a mold zombie {@dice 1d4} hours after death. Iumenta pox can be cured with two successful saving throws.

item.name: Robe of Iridescence
entries: This shimmering cloak is made from the scales of a {@creature scitalis|CCodex}. While in an area of bright or dim light, you can pull the cloak's hood over your head to cause the scales to glimmer and shine. Each creature within 10 feet of you must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of its next turn. Once this property has been used twice, it can't be used again until the next dawn. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

spell.name: Call a Roggenwolf
entries: You call a {@creature roggenwolf|CCodex} within range to your side (though it may take some time to get to you) and can verbally communicate with it for the duration. If you make an offering of meat and a successful {@dc 13} Charisma ability check, the roggenwolf will give you information about nearby locations and prey, including whatever it has seen within the past day. You might be able to persuade a roggenwolf to attack a particular creature or howl at a particular location, at the GM's discretion.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the aatxe moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Know Thoughts
entries: The aatxe can use an action to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. This works like the detect thoughts spell, except it can only read surface thoughts and there is no limit to the duration. It can end this effect as a bonus action or by using an action to change the target.

trait.name: Limited Speech (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: The aatxe can verbally communicate only simple ideas and phrases, though it can understand and follow a conversation without issue.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The aatxe has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The aatxe can use its action to polymorph into a Medium male humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Paw the Earth
entries: The aatxe lowers its horns and paws at the ground with its hooves. Each creature within 30 feet of the aatxe must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the aatxe s Paw the Earth for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The aatxe makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Gore (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aatxe makes one gore attack.

legendary.name: Bulwark (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The aatxe flares crimson with celestial power, protecting those nearby. The next attack that would hit an ally within 5 feet of the aatxe hits the aatxe instead.

entries.name: An Aatxe's Lair
entries: Aatxes prefer to make their homes in caverns or other secluded locations, though they will forego that preference in favor of ruins or shelters which provide a view of the regions they protect.

trait.name: Explosive Death
entries: When the ant is reduced to 0 hp, it explodes in a burst of acid. Each creature within 5 feet of the ant must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The ant has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 20 60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage and the target takes 1 acid damage at the start of its next turn unless the target immediately uses its reaction to wipe off the spit.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

trait.name: Body In Flames
entries: A creature that touches the agnibarra or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects within 5 feet of the agnibarra that aren t being worn or carried ignite.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The agnibarra sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Burning Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Spit Fire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15 30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The ahuizotl can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Spiky Coat
entries: A creature that touches the ahuizotl or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ahuizotl can use its Tail Grab. It then makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Grab
entries: The ahuizotl grabs a creature or item. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). The ahuizotl can then move up to its speed as a bonus action. The {@condition grappled} creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled along 5 feet behind the ahuizotl. A creature being dragged by the ahuizotl makes attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws with disadvantage.

If the target is an object or weapon being held by another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw, or the ahuizotl pulls the object away from the creature. After stealing an object or weapon, the ahuizotl can move up to its speed as a bonus action. The ahuizotl can only grapple one creature or hold one weapon or object at a time. If holding a weapon, it can use its Tail Grab action to make one attack with the weapon with no proficiency bonus

trait.name: Clockwork Encasement
entries: The creature within the machine is a somewhat shapeless mass, both protected and given concrete manipulators by its armor. The clockwork armor has a variety of manipulators that the ahu-nixta can use to attack or to interact with objects outside of the armor. When the ahu-nixta is reduced to 0 hp, its clockwork armor breaks and the ahunixta exits it. Once out of its armor, the creature s pulpy mass no longer receives the benefits of the listed Damage or Condition Immunities, except for psychic and {@condition prone}.

Without its clockwork armor, the ahu-nixta has the following statistics. AC 12, hp 37 ({@dice 5d10 + 10}), Strength 9 (-1), and all its modes of travel are reduced to 20 feet. In addition, it has no attack actions, though it can still cast its spells. The ahu-nixta s body can form eyes, mouths, and grabbing appendages. Its grabbing appendages can pick up objects and manipulate them, but the appendages can t be used for combat. The ahu-nixta s extra appendages can open and close glass-covered viewing ports in the clockwork armor, requiring no action, so it can see and interact with objects outside the armor.
The ahu-nixta can exit or enter its clockwork armor as a bonus action.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork armor of the ahu-nixta is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, as is the creature that controls it as long as the ahu-nixta remains within the armor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ahu-nixta makes three melee attacks. It can cast one at will spell in place of two melee attacks.

action.name: Whirring Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pronged Scepter
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bashing Rod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ahu-nixta's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: One with Wind
entries: An alkonost is immune to the effects of magical and natural wind, including effects that would force it to move, impose disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, or force it to land when flying. In addition, its weapon attacks do an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage if it is within 1 mile of a lightning storm.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Charged Melody {@recharge 6}
entries: The alkonost sings a beautiful melody. Each creature within 30 feet of it that can hear the melody must succeed on a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage the next time it moves.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The alliumite has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring plant life.

trait.name: Tearful Stench
entries: Each creature other than an alliumite within 5 feet of the alliumite when it takes damage must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Tearful Stench of all alliumites for 1 minute.

action.name: Thorn Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Grass Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the alp can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The alp can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Tiny beast it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the alp has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Sleeper's Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and, if the target was sleeping or {@condition unconscious} before it was hit, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} and {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition restrained} condition on itself on a success. The creature must succeed on another saving throw on a following round to end the {@condition frightened} condition.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Alp's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Judging Aura
entries: An undead creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the ammut must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the ammut's Judging Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ammut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Prison Belly
entries: The large belly of the ammut magically sustains the life of those trapped inside it. A creature caught in its belly doesn't need food, water, or air. The ammut can maintain one Medium or smaller creature this way as long as the ammut remains alive.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the ammut can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The ammut makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained} and it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the ammut. An ammut can only have one Medium or smaller creature swallowed at a time.

If the ammut takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the ammut must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the ammut. If the ammut dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ghost Breath (1/Day)
entries: The ammut inhales the tortured spirits of undead within 30 feet. Each undead creature of CR 1 and lower in the area is automatically destroyed. All other undead must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Absorb Spirit (1/Day)
entries: The ammut attempts to absorb the spirit of a dead or undead creature in its belly. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be absorbed by the ammut. A creature absorbed this way is destroyed and can't be reanimated, though it can be restored to life by powerful magic, such as a {@spell resurrection} spell. The ammut regains hp equal to the absorbed creature's hp maximum.

trait.name: Blazing Nimbus
entries: A hostile creature that touches the eye of the gods or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant (good or neutral eyes) or necrotic (evil eyes) damage.

trait.name: Corona of Truth
entries: Allies within 10 feet of the eye of the gods have truesight of 20 feet.

trait.name: Divine Conduit
entries: The deity that created the eye of the gods can see everything the eye sees and can instantly recall the eye to its side at any time.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the eye of the gods can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) radiant (good or neutral eyes) or necrotic (evil eyes) damage.

action.name: Divine Inspiration {@recharge 5}
entries: The eye of the gods inspires all allies within 10 feet. For 1 minute, all inspired creatures have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The kinnara's weapon attacks are magical. When the kinnara hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Eternal Lovers
entries: The kinnara shares a powerful bond with its partner and can't be turned against its partner by magical or non-magical means.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Discordant Refrain {@recharge 5}
entries: The kinnara plays a series of jarring notes on its musical instrument. Each non-celestial creature within 60 feet who can hear the sound must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage but isn't {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Share the Pain
entries: When the kinnara's partner is hit with a melee or ranged attack, the kinnara can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its partner. The damage caused by the attack is divided evenly between the two kinnara.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kinnara's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: The ophanim knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ophanim has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ophanim makes four Light of Judgment attacks.

action.name: Light of Judgment
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Holy Fire {@recharge 5}
entries: The ophanim emits a burst of holy fire. Each creature within 30 feet of the ophanim must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 18d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A humanoid reduced to 0 hp by this damage dies, leaving only a pile of fine ash.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ophanim's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The sammael's weapon attacks are magical. When the sammael hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sacred Duty
entries: The sammael angel can use its bonus action to shift its purpose between Destructor, Executioner, and Punisher.

items.name: Destructor
items.entry: The sammael's purpose is to destroy unholy monuments and statues. Its weapon attacks deal double damage to objects and structures.

items.name: Executioner
items.entry: The sammael's purpose is to slay a specific creature. The angel has advantage on attack rolls against a specific creature, chosen by its deity. As long as the angel and the victim are on the same plane of existence, the angel knows the precise location of the creature.

items.name: Punisher
items.entry: The sammael's purpose is to punish, but not kill, creatures, inflicting long-term suffering on those of its deity's choosing. A creature reduced to 0 hp by the angel loses 3 ({@dice 1d6}) Charisma as its body is horribly scarred by the deity's retribution. The scars last until the creature is cured by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sammael makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe (Executioner Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Slam (Destructor Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) fire damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the angel.

action.name: Whip (Punisher Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. A creature's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the radiant damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The song angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the song angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Horn of Blasting (Recharges 56)
entries: The song angel blows on its ram's horn, emitting a thunderous blast in a 30-foot cone that is audible 600 feet away. Each creature in the cone must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage but isn't {@condition deafened}. Creatures and objects made of glass or crystal have disadvantage on the saving throw and take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) thunder damage instead.

action.name: Horn of Spirits (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The song angel blows on its brass horn, calling forth 10 ({@dice 3d4 + 3}) warrior spirits. These spirits appear within 60 feet of the angel and use {@creature tribal warrior} statistics. When the spirits are summoned, one of them is always an ancient champion that uses {@creature berserker} statistics. They disappear after 1 hour or when they are reduced to 0 hp. These spirits follow the angel's commands.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The angel magically polymorphs into a humanoid that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the angel's choice).

In the new form, the angel retains its game statistics and the ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

reaction.name: Heavenly Inspiration
entries: When a creature the song angel can see fails an ability check or saving throw or misses with a weapon attack, the angel can sing a verse of divine music. If the creature hears this song, it can reroll the failed check, save, or attack roll with advantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The song's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fire and Light
entries: The zoryas' weapon attacks are magical. When the zoryas hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant or fire damage (included in the attack). The zoryas chooses whether its attack does radiant or fire damage before making the attack roll.

trait.name: Open Celestial Gate
entries: As an action, the zoryas opens a gateway to the celestial plane. The gate appears as a shimmering circle that sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet and is framed by twisting, golden strands. The gate lasts 1 hour; though, the zoryas can choose to close it at any time as a bonus action. Once the gate closes, the a ngel, z oryas zoryas is reduced to 0 hp and remains {@condition unconscious} for six days, awakening, fully restored, at sunrise on the seventh day. The zoryas can't pass through its own gate.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The zoryas regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the zoryas takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zoryas' next turn. The zoryas' body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Sun's Guidance (3/Day)
entries: he zoryas has advantage on melee attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel makes two morningstar attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant or fire damage.

action.name: Light of Dawn (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The zoryas' lantern brightens, bathing its environs in brilliant light. Each creature within 30 feet of the zoryas must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. An undead creature who fails this save also takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage. The light dispels up to three spells or other magical effects of 3rd level or lower like the {@spell dispel magic} spell within the area.

action.name: Dusk's Arrival (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The zoryas' lantern darkens, snuffing out nearby natural and magical sources of light. Each creature within 30 feet of the zoryas must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area is bathed in darkness like the darkness spell until the end of the zoryas' next turn.

trait.name: Bat Passivism
entries: No bats or werebats can willingly attack the Bat King. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The Bat King has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Bat King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Bat King has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Bat King's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If he dies, the Bat King's soul reforms on the Astral Plane. In {@dice 1d6} days, it inhabits the body of another bat on the Material Plane which becomes the Bat King with all of the hp and abilities thereof. Only killing every bat on the Material Plane will prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Bat King can use his action to polymorph into a Medium dark-skinned, bearded human man of slight stature, into a Medium bat-humanoid hybrid, or back into his true Small bat form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form with the exception that only the Bat King's hybrid and bat forms retain his flying speed. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying transforms with him.

trait.name: Speak to Bats
entries: The Bat King can communicate with bats as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bat King makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Blood Bite (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d6 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebat lycanthropy.

action.name: Oblivion's Mace (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Screech {@recharge 5}
entries: The Bat King lets loose an ear-shattering screech in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in that area that can hear the screech must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half the thunder damage but isn't {@condition deafened}. This attack deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Summon Bats (2/Day)
entries: The Bat King magically calls {@dice 2d4} {@creature swarm of bats|mm|swarms of bats}. In an urban environment, he can call 1 {@creature werebat|ccodex} (see page 258) instead. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the Bat King and obeying his spoken commands. The creatures remain for 1 hour, until the Bat King dies, or until the Bat King dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary.name: At Will Spell
entries: The Bat King casts one of his at will spells.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Bat King makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Flight (Bat or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The Bat King flies up to his flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bat king's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Bovine Passivism
entries: No bovine creatures or wereboars can willingly attack Brother Ox. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If Brother Ox moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack, the target takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Brother Ox fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Brother Ox has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Brother Ox's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If he dies, Brother Ox's soul reforms on the Astral Plane. In {@dice 1d6} days, it inhabits the body of another bovine on the Material Plane which becomes Brother Ox with all of the hp and abilities thereof. Only killing every bovine on the Material Plane will prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Brother Ox can use his action to polymorph into a Huge ox, a Medium bald human with a short, dark beard, or back into his true Huge ox-headed humanoid form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying transforms with him.

trait.name: Speak with Bovines
entries: Brother Ox can communicate with any bovine creature as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In ox or human form, Brother Ox makes three melee attacks. In his true form, he makes three attacks. one with his gore and two with his unarmed strike.

action.name: Gore (Ox or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Humanoid or True Form Only)
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ki Disruption {@recharge 6}
entries: Brother Ox makes one unarmed strike against a creature to create an instability within the target's essence that lasts {@dice 2d8} days. This instability is harmless unless Brother Ox uses his action to end it early. To do so, Brother Ox and the target must be on the same plane of existence. Brother Ox can use this action again to force the target to make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is reduced to 0 hp. On a success, it takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Brother Ox moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Wholeness
entries: Brother Ox regains 10 hp, is cured of all diseases, and ends one effect lowering his ability scores or hp maximum. Brother Ox can't use this legendary action again until the end of his next turn.

legendary.name: Stunning Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Brother Ox makes one unarmed strike. If it hits a creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles (Humanoid or True Form Only)
entries: When Brother Ox is hit by a ranged weapon attack, he can reduce the damage he takes by 25 ({@dice 1d10 + 20}). If this reduces the damage to 0, Brother Ox can catch the missile if it fits in one hand and he has one hand free. If Brother Ox catches a missile in this way, he can throw the missile as a ranged weapon attack as part of the same reaction. The missile has {@hit 10} to hit, with a short range of 30 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, it deals 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) damage of a type appropriate to the missile.

entries.name: Brother Ox's Lair
entries: Brother Ox's lair is a sprawling, stone monastery atop one of the tallest mountains in the world. The temple's interior is simply appointed and comfortable even for creatures not acclimated to life at extreme altitude. It contains a rock garden, martial arts practice areas, meditation chambers, a library of scrolls, sparse sleeping quarters with simple food and water, and a shrine dedicated to no particular gods.

trait.name: Bird Passivism
entries: No bird or ravenfolk can willingly attack Sampati. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Danger Sense
entries: Sampati has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and can't be surprised.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Sampati fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Sampati has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Sampati's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Sampati has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If he dies, Sampati's soul reforms on the Astral Plane. In {@dice 1d6} days, it inhabits the body of another bird of prey on the Material Plane which becomes the Lord of Vultures with all of the hp and abilities thereof. Only killing every bird of prey on the Material Plane will prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Sampati can use his action to polymorph into a Huge giant vulture, a Medium dark-skinned man with black and gold hair, or back into his true Large, winged humanoid form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form with the exception that only Sampati's true and vulture forms retain his flying speed. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying transforms with him.

trait.name: Speak with Birds
entries: Sampati can communicate with birds as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In humanoid or his true form, Sampati makes three spear attacks. In vulture form, he makes three attacks. one with his beak and two with his talons.

action.name: Spear (Humanoid or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If Sampati throws the spear, it magically reforms in his hand immediately after the attack.

action.name: Beak (Vulture Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Talons (Vulture Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if it is a Huge or smaller creature and Sampati isn't already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Sampati moves up to half his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Wing Buffet (Costs 2 Actions; True or Vulture Form Only)
entries: Sampati beats his wings. Each creature within 10 feet of Sampati must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Dive Bomb (Costs 2 Actions; True or Vulture Form Only)
entries: Sampati flies up to his speed and makes a spear or talon attack against one creature. If the attack hits, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing or slashing damage. Sampati must fly at least 30 feet straight towards the target to use this action. Sampati can't use this action if he is grappling a creature.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lord of vultures's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

3e: {@spell conjure animals} (birds only, cast as a 9th-level spell)

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The Mouse King has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Mouse King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Mouse King has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Mouse King's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If he dies, the Mouse King's soul reforms on the Astral Plane. In {@dice 1d6} days, it inhabits the body of another mouse or rat on the Material Plane which becomes the Mouse King with all of the hp and abilities thereof. Only killing every mouse and rat on the Material Plane will prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Rodent Passivism
entries: No rodents, ratfolk, or wererats can willingly attack the Mouse King. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Mouse King can use his action to polymorph into a Medium black-haired human woman with dark skin and copper eyes or a Small white-haired halfling man with pale skin, dark eyes and a long moustache, a Medium mouse-humanoid hybrid, or back into his true Small mouse form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form with the exception that only his hybrid and true forms retain his climbing speed. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying transforms with him.

trait.name: Speak with Rodents
entries: The Mouse King can communicate with rodents as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The Mouse King wears a ring of spell turning.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In mouse form, the Mouse King makes two bite attacks. In humanoid form, he makes three king's blade attacks. In hybrid form, he makes three attacks. two with his king's blade and one with his bite.

action.name: King's Blade (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite (Mouse or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

action.name: Summon Rodents (2/Day)
entries: The Mouse King magically calls {@dice 2d4} {@creature swarm of rats|mm|swarms of rats}. In an urban environment, he can call {@dice 1d4} {@creature wererat|mm|wererats} instead. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the Mouse King and obeying his spoken commands. The creatures remain for 1 hour, until the Mouse King dies, or until the Mouse King dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary.name: King's Blade
entries: The Mouse King makes one king's blade attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Mouse King moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Quick Casting (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Mouse King casts one innate spell.

entries.name: The Mouse King's Lair
entries: The Mouse King lives in the alleys and sewers of cities. Cities with a high amount of underground and criminal activity are especially attractive to the Mouse King. His lair is full of twisting sewer pipes of various sizes and dark alleyways leading to dead ends or in circles. Some of the pipes and alleyways lead to sewers and alleys in different cities, placing the Mouse King's lair in a space between cities.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mouse king's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Bird Passivism
entries: No bird or ravenfolk can willingly attack the Queen. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The Queen of Birds doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when she flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Queen of Birds fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Queen of Birds has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If she dies, the Queen of Birds' soul reforms on the Astral Plane. In {@dice 1d6} days, it inhabits the body of another bird on the Material Plane which becomes the Queen of Birds with all of the hp and abilities thereof. Only killing every bird on the Material Plane will prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Queen of Birds can use her action to polymorph into a Large jewel-toned eagle, a Medium long-haired elven woman, or back into her true Large, winged humanoid form. Her statistics, other than her size, are the same in each form with the exception that only her true and eagle forms retain her flying speed. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying transforms with her.

trait.name: Speak with Birds
entries: The Queen of Birds can communicate with birds as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Storm Strike Weapons
entries: The Queen of Birds' weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with a weapon attack, the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage of her choice of lightning or thunder damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In eagle or humanoid form, the Queen of Birds makes two attacks. In her true form, she makes three attacks. one with her talons and two with her spear.

action.name: Storm Spear (Humanoid or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 100/300 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning or thunder damage, or 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning or thunder damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the Queen of Birds throws her storm spear, it magically reforms in her hand immediately after the attack.

action.name: Talons (Eagle or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning or thunder damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the Queen of Birds can automatically hit the target with her talons, and she can't make talons attacks against other targets. When the Queen of Birds moves, any Medium or smaller target she is grappling moves with her.

legendary.name: Soar (Eagle or True Form Only)
entries: The Queen of Birds flies up to her flying speed.

legendary.name: Storm Spear (Humanoid or True Form Only)
entries: The Queen of Birds makes a storm spear attack.

legendary.name: Swooping Death (Costs 2 Actions; Eagle or True Form Only)
entries: The Queen of Birds makes an attack with her talons. If the attack htis, she can fly up to half her speed.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Queen of Birds adds 5 to her AC against one melee weapon attack that would hit her. To do so, the Queen of Birds must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

entries.name: The Queen of Birds' Lair
entries: The Queen of Birds' lair is a strange sight. A thin stone spire only three feet wide rises from the ground to 500 feet in the air. Impossibly perched atop this spire is a palace with lush gardens, terraces, and open galleries. The Queen holds court in the palace Haval, surrounded by birds of all varieties and bird-like fey and humanoids such as ravenfolk.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The queen of birds's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Cat Passivism
entries: No cats or weretigers can willingly attack the Queen of Cats. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Queen of Cats has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Queen of Cats fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Queen of Cats has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Queen of Cats' weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Queen of Cats moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If she dies, the Queen of Cats' soul reforms on the Astral Plane. In {@dice 1d6} days, it inhabits the body of another cat on the Material Plane which becomes the Queen of Cats with all of the hp and abilities thereof. Only killing every cat on the Material Plane will prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Safe Fall
entries: When she falls, the Queen of Cats lands on her feet and takes no damage.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Queen of Cats can use her action to polymorph into a Medium human woman, a Small cat, or back into her true Large, cat-headed humanoid form. Her statistics, other than her size, are the same in each form with the exception that only her cat and true forms retain her climbing speed. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying transforms with her.

trait.name: Speak with Felines
entries: The Queen of Cats can communicate with cats as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In human form, the Queen of Cats makes two moon strike attacks. In cat form or her true form, she makes three attacks. two with her claws or moon strike and one with her bite.

action.name: Bite (Cat or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Cat or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Moon Strike
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or shed dim light in a 5-foot radius until the start of the Queen's next turn. As long as it glows, the target gains no benefit from being {@condition invisible}, can't hide, and the next attack made against the target has advantage.

legendary.name: Leap
entries: The Queen of Cats moves up to her speed, jumping or climbing over obstacles in the way. Difficult terrain caused by urban or forested terrain features doesn't cost her extra movement when she leaps.

legendary.name: Swipe (Cat or True Form Only)
entries: The Queen of Cats makes a claw attack.

legendary.name: Scurry (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Queen of Cats moves up to her speed and can Hide.

entries.name: The Queen of Cats' Lair
entries: The Queen of Cats lives in a luxurious extra dimensional palace called Bubastal. The entrance to the palace is difficult to find, often hidden in alleys, sewer entrances, or normally-empty alcoves between buildings. The only constant is the doorway is always in a city. The palace itself is full of carpets and soft furniture, cushions, and many potted plants. The air smells of fragrant herbs, particularly catnip, and incense. Small platforms, steps, and walkways make the entire palace an inquisitive cat's paradise, and all the dcor features tassels and other dangling adornments.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The queen of cats's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Bestowal of Trust
entries: The Queen of Serpents can grant a single creature a +1 enhancement to Wisdom which lasts until the creature harms a reptile of any kind. Only one creature may have this enhancement at any time.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The Queen of Serpents has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Queen of Serpents fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Queen of Serpents has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Queen of Serpents' weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If she dies, the Queen of Serpents' soul reforms on the Astral Plane. In {@dice 1d6} days, it inhabits the body of another serpent on the Material Plane which becomes the Queen of Serpents, with all of the hp and abilities thereof. Only killing every serpent on the Material Plane will prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Serpent Passivism
entries: No serpents can willingly attack the Queen of Serpents. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Speak with Serpents
entries: The Queen of Serpents can communicate with serpents as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Queen of Serpents can use her action to polymorph into a Large {@creature constrictor snake}, a Medium human woman of middle age, or back into her true human-snake hybrid form. Her statistics, other than her size, are the same in each form with the exception that only her snake and true forms retain her climbing and swimming speeds. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying transforms with her.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In human form, the Queen of Serpents makes three shortsword attacks. In her true form, she makes two attacks. one with her bite and one with her shortsword.

action.name: Bite (Snake or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Shortsword (Human or True Form Only)
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict (Snake or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the Queen of Serpents can't constrict another target.

action.name: Mesmerizing Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The Queen of Serpents targets up to six creatures that she can see within 60 feet of her. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 10 minutes. The target is no longer {@condition stunned} if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the Queen of Serpents' Mesmerizing Gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Queen of Serpents makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Queen of Serpents moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Precognition (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Queen of Serpents gets a brief glimpse of the immediate future, gaining advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity-based saving throws until the end of her next turn.

entries.name: The Queen of Serpents' Lair
entries: The Queen of Serpents resides in an ancient stone labyrinth deep in a mountain between a rainforest and a desert. In the winter months and during the rainy season, she can be found in her lair surrounded by tens of thousands of hibernating snakes. During this time, she relies heavily on information from her non-serpentine sources. When the weather changes, she often exits her lair to interact with the humanoid settlements nearby.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The queen of serpents's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aura of Necromancy's Bane
entries: Necromancy spells can't be cast within 120 feet of the ankou. When an undead creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the ankou, it must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Cloak of Ghostly Shadows
entries: As a bonus action while in dim light or darkness, the ankou becomes {@condition invisible}. While {@condition invisible}, the ankou has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks and gains the following.

items: Resistance to acid, cold, fire, lighting, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
Immunity to the {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, and {@condition restrained} conditions.
The ankou can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries: The cloak of ghostly shadows ends when the ankou chooses to end it as a bonus action, when the ankou dies, or if the ankou ends its turn in bright light.

trait.name: Death's Apotheosis
entries: The ankou has the celestial type in addition to the dragon type and its weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the ankou fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ankou can use its Horrifying Presence. It then makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Horrifying Presence
entries: Each creature of the ankou's choice that is within 120 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, its speed is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the creature is instead {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the ankou's Horrifying Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Reaper's Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The ankou exhales cold fire in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead creatures automatically fail the saving throw and treat all damage dealt by this breath weapon as radiant instead of cold.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The ankou magically polymorphs into any beast, humanoid, or undead creature it has seen before that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the ankou's choice). Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form and it doesn't gain any class features or legendary actions of the new form.

action.name: Usher of Souls
entries: The ankou can transport itself and up to eight creatures in contact with it to another plane of existence. This works like the plane shift spell, except dead or incorporeal creatures can be transported and don't have to be willing. The ankou can't use this ability to banish an unwilling creature.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The ankou learns the location of all living creatures within 120 feet. Alternatively, it can learn the location of all undead creatures or creatures that have been dead no longer than 1 hour within 1 mile.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The ankou makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Envelope in Shadow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ankou moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creature whose space it moves through must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: An Ankou's Lair
entries: Ankou are rarely granted a chance to rest, constantly traveling the planes to usher spirits to their final resting places. When an ankou has a moment of respite, it often returns to the lair it kept in life. This sometimes creates awkward situations for the dragon's family if they still reside in this lair; even dragons have some apprehensions about sharing a home with a relativeturned- reaper. When residing alone, an ankou often decorates its lair with mementos that recall its slowly fading memories of its former life, such as portraits of mortal friends long dead, electrum coins minted by a friend from a now-destroyed kingdom, or the spellbooks of a fallen comrade.
All ankou lairs have a pile of bleached bones somewhere within. These death spirits find that they sleep best when nestled on a bed of bones.

trait.name: Aura of Necromancy's Bane
entries: When an undead creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the ankou, the undead must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries: As a bonus action while in dim light or darkness, the ankou becomes {@condition invisible}. The cloak of shadows ends when the ankou chooses to end it as a bonus action, when the ankou dies, or if the ankou ends its turn in bright light.

trait.name: Death Ascended
entries: The ankou has the celestial type in addition to the dragon type.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ankou makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage

action.name: Reaper's Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The ankou exhales cold fire in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead creatures automatically fail the saving throw and treat all damage dealt by this breath weapon as radiant instead of cold.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The ankou magically polymorphs into any beast, humanoid, or undead creature it has seen before that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the ankou's choice). Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form and it doesn't gain any class features or legendary actions of the new form.

action.name: Usher of Souls
entries: The ankou can transport itself and up to eight creatures in contact with it to another plane of existence. This works like the plane shift spell, except dead or incorporeal creatures can be transported and don't have to be willing. The ankou can't use this ability to banish an unwilling creature.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The anophiloi has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

trait.name: Blood Sense
entries: The anophiloi can pinpoint, by scent, the location of living creatures within 30 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The anophiloi makes two attacks. one with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, the anophiloi attaches to it. While attached, the anophiloi doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the anophiloi's turns, the target loses 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) hp due to blood loss.

The anophiloi can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 20 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the anophiloi by succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength check.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Shearing
entries: Whenever the arborcyte suffers 10 or more damage from a single attack, a length of its vines breaks free. This animated tendril is under the arborcyte's control, moving and acting as an extension of the creature. Each tendril has AC 14, 10 hp, and a speed of 10 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arborcyte makes two thorn vine attacks plus one animated tendril attack for each tendril it can see that has been created through its Shearing trait.

action.name: Thorn Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the arborcyte's turns, and tendril attacks against the target have advantage. The arborcyte can grapple up to two creatures at one time.

action.name: Animated Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: While attached to a host, the arcamag has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The arcamag can use its action to polymorph into a small object, such as a ring, wand, orb, rod, or scroll. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While motionless, the arcamag is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

action.name: Attach
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that can cast spells. {@h}The arcamag attaches to the target. While attached, the arcamag doesn't attack. Instead, it causes a handful of changes in its spellcaster host (see Changes to the Host sidebar).

The arcamag can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature other than the host can use its action to detach the arcamag by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check. The host can use its action to detach the arcamag only after the host has expended all of its spell slots for the day, including the extra cantrips and spell slots gained from having the arcamag attached. Doing so doesn't require a Strength check. When the arcamag detaches itself or is detached from a host, the host takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage per spellcaster level.

action.name: Teleport (1/Day)
entries: The arcamag magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space. If it is attached to a host when it uses this action, it automatically detaches.

footer.name: Changes to the Host
entries: The following changes are made to a spellcaster that hosts an arcamag:

items: Three times per short rest, the host can use a bonus action to cast a cantrip that would normally require an action. Each time this is done, the host loses hp equal to its spellcaster level.

The host gains one additional spell slot per level of spell it can cast. Each time this extra slot is used, the host must succeed on a {@DC 10} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
Each time the host casts a spell, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the spell doesn't successfully complete, but the host still expends a spell slot as the arcamag absorbs the power of the spell.

trait.name: Arcane Discharge
entries: When an arcanaphage dies, it explodes in a surge of partially-digested magical energy. Each creature within 5 feet per Feed score must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage per Feed score on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For 1 minute afterward, the affected area is awash with volatile magic. A creature that starts its turn in the affected area takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

trait.name: Hunger
entries: Each time it feeds in combat, it regains hp equal to twice the level of the spell it ate and increases its Feed score by 1. The arcanaphage can't have a Feed score higher than 8, and its Feed score reduces by 1 each time it finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Ingest Magic
entries: At the start of each of the arcanaphage's turns, each creature within 30 feet of it that is currently maintaining concentration on a spell must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature's spell ends and the arcanaphage feeds.

trait.name: Magic Immunity
entries: The arcanaphage is immune to damage from spells. It has advantage on saving throws against all other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arcanaphage makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Voracious
entries: The arcanaphage's tentacles glow when a spell is cast within 30 feet of it, countering the spell. This reaction works like the counterspell spell, except the arcanaphage must always make a spellcasting ability check, no matter the spell level. Its ability check for this is +5. If it successfully counters the spell, the arcanaphage feeds.

trait.name: Astral Devour
entries: A creature hosting an astral snapper's astral form must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw each time it finishes a long rest. On a success, the astral snapper is ejected from the host and the Astral Plane into an unoccupied space in the Material Plane within 10 feet of the host and is {@condition stunned} for 1 round. On a failure, the astral snapper consumes part of the host's internal organs, reducing the host's Constitution score by {@dice 1d4}. The host dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. The reduction lasts until the host finishes a long rest after the astral snapper has been expelled. If the host's Constitution score is reduced to 0, the astral snapper exits the host's body in the Material Plane by tearing its way out through the abdomen. The astral snapper becomes completely corporeal as it exits the host, stepping out of the host at its full size.

From the time the astral snapper succeeds on the initial dive into the host through the Astral Plane until the moment it emerges from the host's abdomen, it can be seen by any creature that can see into the Astral Planeits head buried in the host's back. The astral snapper has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and is effectively {@condition stunned} when in this position until it takes damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The astral snapper makes two attacks with its claws. If both attacks hit the same target, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or its wound becomes a rift to the Astral Plane. The astral snapper immediately passes through, closing the rift behind it. The target is then affected by the astral snapper's Astral Devour trait.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Elusive
entries: The azeban can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The azeban has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The azeban makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Ear-Splitting Yawp {@recharge 5}
entries: The azeban emits a piercing yell in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage but isn't {@condition deafened}. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the area.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The azeban's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Azi Dahaka fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Azi Dahaka has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: Azi Dahaka's three heads grant it advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: Azi Dahaka gets two extra reactions that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Vermin Blood
entries: A creature that hits Azi Dahaka with a melee attack while within 5 feet takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage as the dragon's blood becomes biting and stinging vermin.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Azi Dahaka makes three bite attacks and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Storm Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Azi Dahaka exhales a blast of wind and lightning in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage, is pushed 25 feet away from Azi Dahaka, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning and lightning damage and is pushed, but isn't knocked {@condition prone}. All nonmagical flames in the cone are extinguished.

legendary.name: Control Weather
entries: Azi Dahaka can alter the weather in a 5-mile radius centered on itself. The effect is identical to the control weather spell, except the casting time and effects are immediate.

legendary.name: Call Lightning (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: A bolt of lightning flashes down from the clouds to a point Azi Dahaka can see within 100 feet of it. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Azi Dahaka beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Azi Dahaka can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Cronesight
entries: Baba Yaga has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. As an action, she can observe a target and magically know its current emotional state. If the target fails a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw, she also knows the creature's alignment and discovers a hidden secret about the target.

trait.name: Cronespeech
entries: Creatures with Intelligence 3 or lower obey Baba Yaga unquestioningly. Her utterances are often captured as engravings on nearby stone and wood surfaces. These magical reproductions of her words are made in the Common tongue and fade after several days.

trait.name: Grandmother's Teeth
entries: The iron teeth of Baba Yaga are sentient, magical, and airborne dentures that sometimes work at cross-purposes to the Old Witch. If the teeth and Baba Yaga are getting along, the teeth reside inside her mouth, providing her with a bite attack and access to its spell list. Baba Yaga can cast a spell from the teeth's innate spell list as a bonus action, using her spellcasting ability. Spells cast in this way are removed from the teeth's spells per day total. If the witch and her teeth are not getting along, the teeth will fly around casting its spells as it wishes (often to the benefit of Baba Yaga's enemies).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Baba Yaga fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mortar and Pestle
entries: Baba Yaga flies in a large mortar and pestle, which is immune to damage and can't be the target of spells or effects. It provides the witch partial cover from ranged attacks. Baba Yaga doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when she flies out of an enemy's reach. If Baba Yaga is knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition incapacitated} while flying in the mortar, it will gently set her on the ground and disappear for 1 hour. The pestle remains with the witch.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Baba Yaga makes two pestle slap attacks and one bite attack, or three pestle slap attacks.

action.name: Pestle Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 6d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on concentration checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite (if iron teeth are equipped)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 6d10 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Baba Yaga until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Breath of the Bone Mother {@recharge 5}
entries: Calling on her elemental powers and her mastery of crone-magic, Baba Yaga exhales a great wind in a 40-foot cone that smells of fetid mires and sausages. Creatures caught in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage and is affected by the bestow curse spell for 1 minute. On a success, a target takes half the necrotic damage but is not cursed. In addition, a creature damaged by the wind releases a stinking cloud ({@dc 18} Constitution saving throw against the cloud's poison) centered on it at the beginning of its next turn. The cloud dissipates after {@dice 1d4} rounds.

legendary.name: At Will Spell
entries: Baba Yaga casts one at will spell from her list or from her iron teeth's list if it is equipped.

legendary.name: Pestle Slap
entries: Baba Yaga makes one pestle slap attack.

legendary.name: Breath of the Bone Mother (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Baba Yaga uses Breath of the Bone Mother, if it is available.

reaction.name: Dance of the Time Taunter (1/Day)
entries: When Baba Yaga's turn ends, she can take an additional turn. A creature able to see Baba Yaga dance through time has its understanding of the universe challenged and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The baba yaga's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:
