monster.name: The Iron Teeth of Baba Yaga

action.name: Pinch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Iron's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verball components:

trait.name: Liquid Courage {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, the bar brawl imbibes nearby alcohol to gain access to a hidden reservoir of audacity and grit. The bar brawl gains 7 ({@dice 2d6}) temporary hp for 1 minute.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The bar brawl can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the bar brawl can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. Except for Liquid Courage, the bar brawl can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bar brawl makes two melee attacks or two darts attacks.

action.name: Barstool
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 0 ft., one target in the bar brawl's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) if the bar brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Broken Bottles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 0 ft., one target in the bar brawl's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) slashing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) if the bar brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Darts
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 20/40 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) if the bar brawl has half its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: All allies within 30 feet of Barong gain a +6 bonus to saving throws as long as Barong is conscious.

trait.name: Divine Weapons
entries: Barong's weapon attacks are magical. When he hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage (already included below).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Barong has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Barong has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Barong makes two attacks. one with his bite and one with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 0 ft., plus 18 ({@damage 4d8 + 0}) radiant damage.Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 0} to hit, reach 0 ft., Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit.11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Summon Spirit (1/Day)
entries: Barong can summon any combination of {@dice 2d4} good-aligned {@creature ghost|mm|ghosts}, {@creature uraeus|tob|uraeuses} ({@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}, p. 392), or {@creature couatl|mm|couatls}; {@dice 1d4} {@creature temple dog|tob|temple dogs} ({@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}, p. 378), {@creature unicorn|mm|unicorns}, or good-aligned {@creature wraith|mm|wraiths}; or one {@creature buraq|tob} ({@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}, p. 48) or {@creature deva}. The spirits and celestials appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of Barong and act as his allies. They remain for 1 minute or until Barong dismisses them as an action.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: Barong makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Enlightening Roar
entries: Each creature he chooses within 30 feet of him can immediately repeat a saving throw to end one condition currently affecting it.

legendary.name: Divine Command (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Barong roars a command at one allied undead or celestial within 30 feet of him. It can move up to its speed and make one attack as a reaction. The creature doesn't provoke an opportunity attack from this movement.

reaction.name: Divine Protection
entries: When a creature makes an attack against Barong or one of his allies within 30 feet, Barong grants the target of the attack a +5 bonus to its AC until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The bat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The bat makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@h 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@h 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the bat can't use its claws against another target.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The bat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the bat can't bite another target. The bat regains hp equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bearfolk cheiftain hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Frenzy (1/rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the bearfolk can trigger a berserk frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While in frenzy, it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks and has advantage on attack rolls. Attack rolls made against a frenzied bearfolk have advantage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bearfolk has advantage on Wisdom({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Savage Charge
entries: If the bearfolk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a battleaxe attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the bearfolk can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bearfolk makes two attacks with its battleaxe and one with its bite.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used two-handed.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the bearfolk chieftain can, as a reaction, utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll, provided it can hear and understand the bearfolk chieftain. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the bearfolk chieftain is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Viscid Shell
entries: When a creature hits the bearmit crab with a slashing or piercing melee weapon, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, or its weapon becomes stuck to the bearmit crab's shell. While the weapon is stuck, it can't be used. A creature can pull the weapon free by taking an action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check and succeeding.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bearmit crab has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the bearmit crab remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal pile of rocks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bearmit crab makes two attacks. one claw attack and one bite attack or two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The bearmit crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The bilwis can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in the bilwis' space and within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Horrifying Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the bloody bones that starts its turn within 10 feet of the bloody bones must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the bloody bones' Horrifying Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Horrific Imitation
entries: The bloody bones chooses one creature it can see. It moves, acts, and speaks in a macabre imitation of the creature. Its utterances are nonsense, and it can't understand the languages of its chosen target. It maintains this imitation until it dies. A creature that hears and sees the bloody bones can tell it is performing an imitation with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bloody bones makes two claw attacks. It can use its Dark Stare in place of one claw attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dark Stare
entries: The bloody bones stares balefully at one creature it can see within 60 feet. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on all attacks until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Its Crown Runs Red
entries: When it is hit by an attack, the bloody bones regains 5 ({@dice 1d10}) hit points and has resistance to that damage type until the end of its next turn as life-giving blood pours from the top of its skull.

monster.name: Bookkeeper
languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Between the Lines
entries: As a bonus action while within 30 feet of its book, the bookkeeper can hop inside its book. While inside its book, the bookkeeper has a flying speed of 30 feet and is indistinguishable from ink on a page.

trait.name: Book Bound
entries: A bookkeeper makes all attacks, saving throws, and skill checks with advantage when its creator is within 60 feet of its book. The bookkeeper's hp maximum is reduced by 1 for every minute it is further than 60 feet from its book. When its hp maximum reaches 0, it dies. If its creator dies, the bookkeeper can be convinced to pass ownership of the book to a new creature if the creature succeeds on a {@dc 13} Charisma check. The new owner becomes the bookkeeper's new "creator" and inherits the bookkeeper along with the book.

trait.name: Disintegrate
entries: When the bookkeeper dies, the book it is bound to is also destroyed.

action.name: Ink Splash
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 1 poison damage.

action.name: Elusive Pages
entries: While inside its book, the bookkeeper magically turns its book {@condition invisible} until it attacks, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). The bookkeeper is also {@condition invisible} while inside the {@condition invisible} book

trait.name: Adhesive
entries: The boot grabber adheres to anything that touches it. A Large or smaller creature adhered to the boot grabber is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 13}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The boot grabber can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the boot grabber remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a dirty puddle of water.

action.name: Adhesive Hands
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the boot grabber can't make adhesive hands attacks against other targets.

action.name: Unearthly Hum
entries: The boot grabber targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. It emits a high frequency humming noise which can only be heard by the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or move toward the boot grabber on its turn by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn when it comes within 5 feet of the boot grabber.

trait.name: Gem Illumination
entries: As a bonus action, the carbuncle can cause its garnet to glow or not. While glowing, the garnet sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The carbuncle has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The carbuncle makes one bite attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Light Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The carbuncle shoots a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line of scintillating light from the garnet on its forehead. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Feline Terror
entries: Each creature in the swarm must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the swarm's Feline Terror for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny cat. The swarm can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., up to two creatures in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Consumption
entries: As a bonus action, a cauldronborn can consume one potion within 5 feet of it that is not being worn or carried. Along with the potion's effect, the cauldronborn's hp maximum increases by 3 ({@dice 1d6}) and it gains the same number of hp.

trait.name: Detect Elixir
entries: The cauldronborn can pinpoint the location of potions and magic items within 60 feet of it. Outside of 60 feet, it can sense the general direction of potions within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The cauldronborn regains 2 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

trait.name: Sprint
entries: The cauldronborn triples its speed until the end of its turn when moving toward a potion it has detected.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cauldronborn makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Call Potion {@recharge 5}
entries: The cauldronborn releases a hungry screech, magically reaching out to nearby potions. All potions within 10 feet of the cauldronborn magically move toward the cauldronborn by rolling out of backpacks, hopping off of belts, unburying themselves, etc. A creature wearing or carrying a potion must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or its potion moves to within 5 feet of the cauldronborn. The target must make a separate saving throw for each potion it is attempting to keep in its possession.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur chieftain makes two attacks. one with its pike and one with its hooves or two with its longbow.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the centaur chieftain can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the centaur chieftain. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the centaur chieftain is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Rearing Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The centaur chieftain rears back on its hind legs and makes a powerful stomp with its hooves. Each creature within 15 feet of the chieftain must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The attack leaves the centaur chieftain vulnerable, reducing its Armor Class by 2 until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Acid Touch
entries: As an action, the child of Yggdrasil destroys one nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, such as a rope, plank, candlestick, or even an entire bronze cauldron.

trait.name: Forest Camouflage
entries: The child of Yggdrasil has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in forest terrain.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The child of Yggdrasil has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The child of Yggdrasil makes three claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Feybane
entries: Creatures of the fey type don't recover spells during a long rest while within 60 feet of the chuhaister. In addition, the chuhaister automatically sees through magical illusions created by spells of 3rd level or lower and has advantage on saving throws and ability checks to detect or see through illusion spells of 4th level or higher.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the chuhaister has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chuhaister makes two greatclub attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 5d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Deadfall Shield {@recharge 5}
entries: When the chuhaister or one ally within 30 feet of it is hit by an attack, the chuhaister can create a magical, wooden barrier that interrupts the attack. The attack causes no damage. The shield splinters and disappears afterwards.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The chupacabra has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Running Leap
entries: With a 10-foot running start, the chupacabra can long jump up to 25 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the chupacabra attaches to the target. While attached, the chupacabra doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the chupacabra's turns, the target loses 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) hp due to blood loss. The chupacabra can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after the target is reduced to 0 hp. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the chupacabra.

action.name: Fearful Gaze
entries: The chupacabra fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the chupacabra's Fearful Gaze for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Malodorous Stench
entries: When the chupacabra is reduced to less than half of its maximum hp, it releases a foul, sulphurous stench. Each creature within 5 feet of the chupacabra must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Explosive Core
entries: When the assassin is destroyed, its core explodes, projecting superheated steam and shrapnel. Each creature within 5 feet of the construct must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The assassin is immune to any spell or effect, other than its disassembly trait, that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The assassin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psychic Susceptibility
entries: If the assassin takes psychic damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The assassin deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The assassin's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork assassin makes two rapier attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

action.name: Disassembly
entries: The assassin breaks its body down into a snakelike, segmented cylinder, which allows it to move through a space as narrow as 6 inches wide. It can reassemble itself into its true form by using this action again. While disassembled into its snake form, the assassin can't attack and attack rolls against it have advantage.

trait.name: Domestic Retainer
entries: The servant can cast the mending and prestidigitation cantrips at will without requiring spell components.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The servant is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The servant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The soldier is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Intimidating Legions
entries: A single clockwork soldier's rigid movements appear silly, but, when gathered in numbers, they become an inhuman terror. When the clockwork soldier makes a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) check, it gains a bonus on that check equal to the number of other clockwork soldiers the target can see or hear.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Overdrive Flurry {@recharge 6}
entries: The soldier makes four halberd attacks. After taking this action, it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Object Reading
entries: By concentrating for 10 minutes on a specific object, a corpse thief learns more about the object's most recent owner. The effects of this trait are different depending on if the most recent owner is alive or dead. This trait only works once per object.

items: If the most recent owner is alive, the corpse thief sees through that person's eyes for 10 minutes. This works like the clairvoyance spell, except the most recent owner is the sensor and controls which direction it is pointed, how far it can see, etc. The most recent owner must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a success, it gets the sensation that it is being watched.

If the most recent owner is dead, the corpse thief can learn five things about the person's life through dream-like visions and emotions. This works like the speak with dead spell, except the spirit can only answer questions about events in which the object was present.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corpse thief makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Steal
entries: The corpse thief targets one creature within 5 feet of it and attempts to steal one small item. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or lose one non-weapon, non-armor object that is small enough to fit in one hand.

trait.name: Pseudocorporeal
entries: The crimson mist is weightless and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing.

trait.name: Sanguine Feast
entries: Whenever the crimson mist deals necrotic damage to a living creature with blood in its body, the creature's hp maximum is reduced by the same amount and the mist regains hp equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The crimson mist has the following flaws:

items: {@i Forbiddance.} The crimson mist can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The crimson mist takes 20 force damage if it ends its turn above or within running water.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The crimson mist takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The mist moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter a Medium or smaller creature's space. When the mist enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the mist. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the mist enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 15 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 15 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the mist's turns. When the mist moves, the engulfed creature doesn't move with it, and is freed. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 14} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the mist. A creature within 5 feet of the mist can take an action to pull a creature out of the mist. Doing so requires a {@dc 14} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The mist can only engulf one Medium or smaller creature at a time.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The cueyatl can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The cueyatl has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The cueyatl has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The cueyatl's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The cueyatl can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The cueyatl has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The cueyatl moon priest has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The cueyatl's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Night's Chill {@recharge 5}
entries: The cueyatl moon priest harnesses moonlight, dispelling magical light in a 30-foot radius. In addition, each hostile creature within 30 feet must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) cold damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from the moon priest is not affected.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cueyatl moon priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The cueyatl moon priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The cueyatl can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The cueyatl has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The cueyatl has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Speak with Sea Life
entries: The cueyatl sea priest can communicate with amphibious and water breathing beasts and monstrosities as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The cueyatl's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cueyatl sea priest is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The cueyatl sea priest has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The cueyatl can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The cueyatl has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The cueyatl has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The cueyatl's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage if used with two hands.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The simhamukha's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The simhamukha has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Smite (3/Day)
entries: When the simhamukha hits a creature with a melee attack, it can choose to deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The simhamukha makes two attacks with its kartika, or one with its kartika and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the simhamukha kills the target by decapitating it.

action.name: Kartika
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Staff Sweep {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the simhamukha must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Weird {@recharge 6}
entries: The simhamukha draws upon the deepest fears and regrets of the creatures around it, creating illusions visible only to them. Each creature within 40 feet of the simhamukha, must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage on a failure or ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dakini, simhamukha's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monster.name: Dark Father
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Death Waits
entries: The dark father has disadvantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that has all of its hp.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The dark father can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: None May Stop Death
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of a dark father regains hp through any means other than resting, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and have disadvantage on its next death saving throw.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: Melee Spell Attack. {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Final Curtain
entries: The dark father targets a corpse it can see within 30 feet that has been dead for no longer than 1 hour. A stream of dark energy flows between the corpse and the dark father. At the end of the dark father's next turn, the dark father absorbs the corpse and it vanishes completely. Any worn items or possessions are unaffected. A corpse destroyed in this manner can't be retrieved other than by a {@spell wish} spell or similar magic.

reaction.name: Banish Hope
entries: When a spell from the evocation or necromancy school is cast within 30 feet of the dark father, the dark father can counter the spell with a successful ability check. This works like the counterspell spell with a +5 spellcasting ability check, except the dark father must make the ability check no matter the level of the spell.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The dark eye has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Gaze of Shadows
entries: hen a creature that can see the dark eye's eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the dark eye, the dark eye can force it to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw if the dark eye isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failure, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the dark eye until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the dark eye in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dark eye has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: he dark eye makes two attacks with its dagger.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: Same as the dark eye.

trait.name: Darksight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the dark folk's darkvision.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The dark servant has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the dark servant's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: Same as the dark eye.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: he dark servant makes two attacks with its sickle.

action.name: Sickle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: Same as the dark eye.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The dark voice regains 5 hp at the start of its turn if it is in an area of dim light or darkness. The dark voice only dies if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: Same as the dark eye.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dark voice makes two attacks with its mace.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Whispers of Shadow {@recharge 5}
entries: The dark voice speaks in Umbral, whispering of what it sees beyond the dark. The area within 30 feet of the dark voice becomes dimly lit until the end of the dark voice's next turn. Only sunlight can illuminate the area brightly during this time. Each non-dark folk creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Chemosh can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aura of Fury
entries: The calm emotion spell instantly fails when cast within 60 feet of Chemosh. In addition, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Chemosh must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or enter a mad rage, attacking the nearest creature it can see until the start of its next turn. At the start of his turn, Chemosh can decide whether this aura is active.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Chemosh fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Chemosh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Chemosh's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Chemosh makes three longsword attacks and one shortsword attack, or three longbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage or 24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage. The range and accuracy of Chemosh's arrows are not affected by water.

legendary.name: Longsword
entries: Chemosh makes one longsword attack.

legendary.name: Call Carrion-Eater (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Chemosh summons a {@creature vrock} at a point within 60 feet of him. The {@creature vrock} has a swim speed equal to its fly speed. It remains for 1 minute, until it or Chemosh dies, or until Chemosh dismisses it as an action. Chemosh can summon up to three {@creature vrock|mm|vrocks} per day.

legendary.name: Swim
entries: Chemosh swims up to his swim speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Chemosh's Lair
entries: Chemosh resides in a palace of iron at the bottom of the Bloodstained Sea in the Abyss. The palace is shaped like a massive hermit crab and slowly plods across the ocean floor, surveying the endless war of damned spirits that fills the Bloodstained Sea.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chemosh, demon lord of conquest's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fire Dancer
entries: Whenever Chittr'k'k is subjected to fire or necrotic damage, he takes no damage and instead is unaffected by spells and other magical effects that would impede his movement. This trait works like the {@spell freedom of movement} spell, except it only lasts for 1 minute.

trait.name: Quick Escape
entries: As a bonus action, Chittr'k'k teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Chittr'k'k fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Chittr'k'k makes two Soul Bite attacks or three Necrotic Flame attacks.

action.name: Soul Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Necrotic Flame
entries: Ranged Magic Attack. {@hit 10} to hit, 120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Soul Bite
entries: Chittr'k'k uses his soul bite attack.

legendary.name: Stumble
entries: Chittr'k'k commands a rat to dash under the feet of a creature within 60 feet, causing it to stumble. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or it drops whatever it is holding and falls {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Plague Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Chittr'k'k surrounds himself with hideous vapors from his pipe, a screeching, pestilent mix of damned souls and poison gas. The gas spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of Chittr'k'k must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned}. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and is not {@condition poisoned}. The gas lasts until Chittr'k'k uses this legendary action again or until Chittr'k'k dies. Rats, rattok demons, wind demons, and Chittr'k'k are immune to the effects of Plague Breath.

reaction.name: Soul Devouring
entries: When Chittr'k'k or a rattok demon within 120 feet of Chittr'k'k reduces a creature to 0 hp, the demon lord devours that creature's soul. Chittr'k'k gains 19 ({@dice 3d12}) temporary hp and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or suffer two failed death saving throws.

entries.name: Chittr'k'k's Lair
entries: Chittr'k'k's lair is a vast realm of tunnels and dank caverns with thousands, if not millions, of rats, ratfolk, rattok demons and other horrors, a noisy place of constant squeals and skittering filled with the rank smells of blood, offal, and sweat. It is filled with snarling creatures preying on one another in its narrow, bone-strewn passages. Its only illumination comes from unholy sigils and territorial markings made in multi-colored, pale luminous ink.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Rangda fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Rangda has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rangda makes three attacks. two with her claws and one with her tongue lash.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or become infected with cackle fever. If the target succeeds, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

action.name: Tongue Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or its Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

action.name: Hypnotic Sway {@recharge 5}
entries: Rangda sways her body and tongue in a mesmerizing rhythm. Each creature of her choice that is within 30 feet of her that can see her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Teleport
entries: Rangda magically teleports to an unoccupied space within line of sight. Alternatively, Rangda magically enters her home plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: Rangda makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Rangda uses her Teleport ability.

legendary.name: Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Rangda casts a spell.

legendary.name: Hypnotic Sway (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Rangda uses her Hypnotic Sway ability, if it is available.

entries.name: Rangda's Lair
entries: Rangda's lair is nestled beneath an immense, twisted tree strewn with corpse flowers and surrounded by warlock's trumpetblooms (see page 372) deep in a vast bog of the Abyss. The tree must reshape itself to grant access to the Witch Queen's abode, an earthy, worm-ridden manse that reeks of decay.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rangda, demon lord of witches's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Typhon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Typhon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Typhon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Typhon makes three attacks. two with his snake bites and one with his or Enthralling Touch.

action.name: Snake Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage at the start of its turn. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}. Typhon has two tails, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Enthralling Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and all ability checks. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic.

legendary.name: Snake Bites
entries: Typhon makes one snake bites attack.

legendary.name: Enthrall
entries: Typhon makes one enthralling touch attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Typhon beats his wings. Each creature within 15 feet of Typhon must succeed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Typhon can then fly up to half his flying speed.

entries.name: Typhon's Lair
entries: Typhon rules Tarkoros, a layer of the Abyss covered in dense forests and rocky hills that radiate out from a singular mountain. Within the mount is a honeycomb of tunnels and immense caverns that Typhon fills with beautiful treasure and hideous horrors. Monsters of all kinds spring up in the shadow of Typhon's wings. The creatures lurk in the halls of Tarkoros and spill out to seek portals to the Material Plane.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The typhon, father of monsters's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Skin of the Forge
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the alnaar must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that touches the alnaar or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. Nonmagical weapons and objects with Armor Class 15 or lower are immediately destroyed after coming into contact with the alnaar's skin. Weapons that hit the alnaar deal their damage before being destroyed. This trait is suppressed if the alnaar is starving.

trait.name: Starving Wrath
entries: If an alnaar hasn't fed on a Medium-sized or larger creature within the last 12 hours, it is starving. While starving, the alnaar's Armor Class is reduced by 2, it has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all of its hp, and will direct its attacks at a single foe regardless of tactical consequences. Once it feeds on a Medium-sized or larger corpse or brings a Medium-sized or larger creature to 0 hp, it is no longer starving.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alnaar makes three fiery fangs attacks.

action.name: Fiery Fangs
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Flare (Recharge Special)
entries: The alnaar becomes super-heated, expelling momentous energy outwards in a 20-foot radius blast around it. Each creature caught in the blast must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage and 22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the fire and force damage but isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The fire ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. After using Flare, the alnaar is starving. It can't use Flare if it is starving.

reaction.name: On the Hunt
entries: When a creature the alnaar can see moves, the alnaar can move up to 20 feet toward the moving creature. If the alnaar moves within 10 feet of that creature, it can make one fiery fangs attack against the creature.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The cipactli can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The cipactli has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while underwater.

trait.name: Water Step
entries: As a bonus action, the cipactli can liquefy itself, disappearing from its current location and reappearing in an unoccupied space it can see within 20 feet. Its current location and the new location must be connected by water in some way: a stream, ooze, soggy ground, or even runoff from a drain pipe.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cipactli makes two bite attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}), and the cipactli uses its Devouring Embrace.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Devouring Embrace
entries: The cipactli devours a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The devoured target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the cipactli, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of the cipactli's turns as the fiend's lesser mouths slowly consume it.

If the cipactli moves, the devoured target moves with it. The cipactli can only devour one target at a time. A creature, including the devoured target, can take its action to pry the devoured target out of the cipactli's many jaws by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check.

action.name: Ancient Lullaby {@recharge 5}
entries: A cipactli sings a soporific, primordial song of eternal rest and divine repose from its many mouths. Each creature within 100 feet of the cipactli that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. A creature awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This song has no effect on constructs and undead.

trait.name: Aura of Cacophony
entries: The demon's presence is extremely distracting. Each creature within 100 feet of the echo demon and that can hear it has disadvantage on concentration checks.

action.name: Iron Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage and if the creature is wearing metal armor, it must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Everywhere at Once {@recharge 5}
entries: The echo demon teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space. Immediately after teleporting, it can make an iron claws attack with advantage as a bonus action.

action.name: Echoes of the Abyss (1/Day)
entries: The echo demon summons horrible wails from the deep crevasses of the Abyss. Creatures within 60 feet who can hear the wails must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the echo demon's next turn. An affected creature continues hearing the troubling echoes of these cries until it finishes a long rest, and it has disadvantage on Intelligence checks until then.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the fulad-zereh's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the demon, the fulad-zereh can force it to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw if the demon isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition petrified}. Otherwise, a creature that fails the saving throw begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the demon until the start of its next turn, when it can avert is eyes again. If the creature looks at the demon, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Weeping Acid
entries: A creature that touches the fulad-zereh or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fulad-zereh makes two attacks. one with its barbed whip and one with its battleaxe.

action.name: Barbed Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and, if the target is Large or smaller, it is pulled up to 25 feet toward the demon. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns as a barb of pure Abyssal energy lodges itself in the wound. Each time the demon hits the barbed target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound each round increases by 5 ({@damage 1d10}). Any creature can take an action to remove the barb with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The barb crumbles to dust if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The neophron can use its action to polymorph into a tiger or a wolf, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The neophron makes three attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the neophron, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the neophron's turns.

The neophron can only swallow one creature at a time. If a humanoid dies while swallowed, it transforms into a ghast. At the start of its next turn, the neophron regurgitates the ghast into an unoccupied space within 10 feet. The ghast is under the neophron's control and acts immediately after the neophron in the initiative count.

If the neophron takes 20 or more damage in a single turn from a creature inside it, the neophron must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the neophron. If the neophron dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The pishacha can use its action to polymorph into a tiger or a wolf, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pishacha makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Demonic Possession {@recharge 6}
entries: One humanoid that the pishacha can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be possessed by the pishacha; the pishacha then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses some control of its body, succumbing to a random short-term madness (see the System Reference Document 5.1) each round for {@dice 3d6} rounds. At the end of the {@dice 3d6} rounds, the pishacha becomes dormant within the body.

While possessing a victim, the pishacha attempts to seize control of the body again every {@dice 1d4} hours. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or succumb to another {@dice 3d6} round period of random short-term madness. Even if the target succeeds, it is still possessed. If the target is still possessed at the end of a long rest, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or gain a long-term madness.

While possessing a victim, the pishacha can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except those that can turn or repel fiends, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hp, the pishacha ends it as a bonus action, or the pishacha is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. The pishacha can also be forced out if the victim eats a bowl of rice that has been cooked in holy water. When the possession ends, the pishacha reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.
The target is immune to possession by the same pishacha for 24 hours after succeeding on the initial saving throw or after the possession ends.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The pishacha magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

trait.name: Grinding Maws
entries: The plaresh can burrow through harder substances such as wood, stone, or even metal. While doing so its burrow speed is reduced to half, and it creates a cluster of bore holes that leaves the material porous and weak. The material has 5 to its AC and half the usual hp.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: rThe plaresh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The plaresh can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the plaresh can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny worm. The plaresh can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target is wearing nonmagical armor, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative 1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

action.name: Infest Corpse (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The plaresh targets one dead humanoid in its space. The body is destroyed, and a new plaresh rises from the corpse. The newly created plaresh is free-willed but usually joins its creator.

trait.name: Bottled Soul (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the rattok demon consumes one of the bottled souls in its possession, regaining 7 ({@dice 2d4 + 2}) hp and gaining advantage on all attack rolls and ability checks for 1 round. Any non-fiend who consumes a bottled soul regains 7 ({@dice 2d4 + 2}) hit points and must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition stunned} for 1 round and {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. On a success, the creature is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

trait.name: Fire Dancer
entries: Whenever the rattok demon is subjected to fire or necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead is unaffected by spells and other magical effects that would impede its movement. This trait works like the freedom of movement spell, except it only lasts for 1 minute.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The rattok has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rattok makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Necrotic Rush {@recharge 5}
entries: The rattok unleashes a wave of shadowy versions of itself that fan out and rake dark claws across all creatures within 15 feet. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Frothing Rage
entries: The spree demon has advantage on attacks if it saw another spree demon make a successful attack within the last minute.

trait.name: Spree Madness
entries: If a creature confused by the spree demon's claw attack reduces a target to 0 hp, the confused creature must make a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or gain a short-term madness (see the System Reference Document 5.1). If a creature fails this saving throw again while already suffering from a madness, it gains a long-term madness instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spree demon makes two claw attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} this way, the creature believes it has shrunk to half its normal size. All attacks against the creature do an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage, and the creature's attacks do half damage. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, and the creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target can't take reactions and must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn for 1 minute. This works like the confusion spell. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The vellso has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vellso has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The vellso's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vellso can climb surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vellso makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage and contract the carrion curse disease (see sidebar).

action.name: Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack. {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Arrow Bane
entries: When the wind demon is targeted by an attack or spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a 6, the wind demon is unaffected, and the attack is reflected back at the attacker as though it originated from the wind demon, turning the attacker into the target.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wind demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wind demon makes two frost claw attacks.

action.name: Frost Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

reaction.name: Swift as Frost
entries: After a creature the wind demon can see damages it with an attack, the wind demon can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Devouring Swarm
entries: If a creature has three or more yek attached to it from a bite attack at the end of its turn, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or its Constitution score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} as the demons feast upon the creature's flesh.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The yek has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The yek has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the yek's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yek makes one bite attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and, if the target is Large or smaller, the yek demon attaches to it. While attached, the yek demon can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The yek demon can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the yek demon by succeeding on a {@dc 13} Strength check.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The yek has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The yek has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the yek's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alpha yek makes one bite attack and two claw attacks. It can make a bone shard attack in place of a claw attack if it has a bone shard available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bone Shard
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a piece of the bone breaks and sticks in the target's wound. The target takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns as long as the bone remains lodged in its wound. A creature, including the target, can take its action to remove the bone by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The bone also falls out of the wound if the target receives magical healing A yek typically carries 3 ({@dice 1d6}) bone shards, which are destroyed on a successful hit. It can use its action to tear a bone shard from a corpse within 5 feet.

trait.name: Boon of the Bat
entries: A creature struck by one of the speaker to the darkness' attacks must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the start of the speaker's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The speaker to the darkness makes two quarterstaff attacks or two sling attacks.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Drawn from Beyond {@recharge 5}
entries: The speaker conjures up to 3 ghasts. The ghasts appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the speaker that the speaker can see. The ghasts follow the speaker's commands, and it is immune to their Stench. It can't have more than 3 ghasts conjured at one time.

action.name: Extinguish Light (1/rest)
entries: The speaker creates a 15-foot-radius sphere of magical darkness on a point it can see within 60 feet. This darkness works like the darkness spell, except creatures inside it have disadvantage on saving throws and the speaker and its conjured ghasts are unaffected by the darkness.

trait.name: Heightened Spell (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, a target of the witch queen's choice within 60 feet of her has disadvantage on its saving throw against her next spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The witch queen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the witch queen has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Maddening Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or use its reaction to move up to its speed and make a melee attack against the nearest enemy of the witch queen.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The witch queen is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The witch queen has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The devil shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The devil shark has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil shark has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The devil shark can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy. This command is limited to simple concepts such as "come here," "defend me," or "attack this target."

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The devil shark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Swallow
entries: The devil shark makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the devil shark, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the devil shark's turns. A devil shark can have two Large, four Medium, or six Small creatures swallowed at a time.

If the devil shark takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a swallowed creature, the devil shark must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} within 10 feet of the devil shark. If the devil shark dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Freezing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The devil shark exhales a 60-foot cone of supernaturally cold water. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 54 ({@damage 12d8}) cold damage and is pushed 20 feet away from the devil shark. On a success, a target takes half the damage but isn't pushed.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Builder of Hell
entries: During a long rest, Belphegor can create three flesh golems or three gorgons. The creatures are made from various fleshy and metal parts stored on Prime. The constructs obey his commands until they are slain or disassemble into pieces after 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Belphegor fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lord of Openings
entries: Belphegor retains his humble roots. Creatures in his presence find they don't have full control of their body's orifices. A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of Belphegor must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or suffer one of the following effects until the end of its next turn (rolled randomly or chosen by the GM).

items.name: Tears
items.entry: The creature's eyes swell with tears, causing the creature to become {@condition blinded}.

items.name: Vomit
items.entry: The creature vomits uncontrollably and is considered {@condition poisoned} and can't speak.

items.name: Defecation
