items.entry: The creature's insides cramp as it voids its bowels, becoming {@condition incapacitated} in the process.

items.name: Discharge of Wax
items.entry: A thick wax fills the creature's ears, causing the creature to become {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Belphegor's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pitted Sockets
entries: Mist swirls in the depths of Belphegor's pit-like eyes. Creatures who look upon Belphegor lose all benefits from their next long rest as they struggle to expel the devil's hollow gaze from their minds.

trait.name: Prime
entries: Belphegor rides a grand, floating palanquin named Prime. This overly complex device-turned-vehicle is immune to damage and can't be the target of spells or effects. It provides the demon lord partial cover from ranged attacks. Belphegor doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when he flies out of an enemy's reach while on Prime. If Belphegor is knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition incapacitated} while flying on Prime, it will gently set him on the ground and disappear for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Belphegor makes three soul flail attacks.

action.name: Soul Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage. Each creature trapped in his flail by Form the Chain must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Endless Complexity (1/Day)
entries: Belphegor activates the many complexities built atop Prime. All creatures who can see Belphegor must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds as fruitless comprehension takes hold of their minds. A creature affected by this ability feels compelled to tinker, conceive, or otherwise invent an overly complex object related to its class and background. Any downtime taken during the next seven days after failing this saving throw is spent toiling on this object until ultimately, nothing comes of it.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Belphegor moves up to half his speed.

legendary.name: Soul Flail
entries: Belphegor makes one soul flail attack.

legendary.name: Endless Complexity (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Belphegor uses his Endless Complexity if it is available.

reaction.name: Form the Chain
entries: When Belphegor is hit by an attacker he hit with his soul flail in the past minute, the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or the attack does no damage and the attacker takes the place of a damned soul, teleporting to its location on the flail instantly. The attacker is {@condition paralyzed} and experiences tremendous psychic suffering as it helps to hold the head of the flail to the handle. At the end of its next turn, it returns to the space it previously occupied or to the nearest unoccupied space. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature can't be affected by Belphegor's Form the Chain again until Belphegor hits it with another Soul Flail attack.

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to Parzelon that starts its turn within 20 feet of him must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, unless Parzelon is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Parzelon's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Parzelon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Parzelon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Parzelon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Parzelon makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Serpentine Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Summon Devil (1/Day)
entries: Parzelon summons {@dice 1d4} {@creature barbed devil|mm|barbed devils} or {@dice 1d4} {@creature spawn of Parzelon|ccodex}. A summoned devil appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Parzelon, acts as an ally, and can't summon other devils. It remains for 1 minute, or until Parzelon dismisses it as an action.

legendary.name: Serpentine Lash
entries: Parzelon makes one serpentine lash attack.

legendary.name: Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Parzelon casts one spell.

legendary.name: Horn of Nessus (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Parzelon blows his accursed, silver horn, which emits a sickening blast in a 30-foot cone that is audible 600 feet away. Each creature in the cone must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 32 ({@damage 5d12}) poison damage and is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. An {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The parzelon, king of secrets is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). He requires no material components to cast his spells. The parzelon, king of secrets has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the spawn's darkvision.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The spawn has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The spawn has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the spawn's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the spawn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the spawn can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spawn of Parzelon makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Tranquil Roar {@recharge 4}
entries: The spawn emits a dreadfully alluring purr. Each creature within 20 feet of it that can hear it and that isn't a devil must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spawn of parzelon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the imp's darkvision.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the imp is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hp equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Heat Metal (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the imp casts the heat metal spell without expending any material components (spell save {@dc 12}).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The imp has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Fire Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) fire damage and if the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take another 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of its next turn.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) fire damage and if the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Faultless Tracker
entries: If the infernal knight is given a quarry by its lord, the knight knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The infernal knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The infernal knight's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The infernal knight regains 10 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The infernal knight makes two melee attacks or uses its Hellfire Bolt twice. It can replace one attack with Reave Soul.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage. A creature hit by the sword must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks based on Strength or Dexterity until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Hellfire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage. A creature hit must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Reave Soul {@recharge 5}
entries: The infernal knight targets a creature with 0 hp that it can see within 60 feet of it. If the creature is alive, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or die and have its soul drawn into the infernal knight's greatsword. If the creature is dead and has been dead for less than 1 minute, its soul is automatically captured. When the infernal knight captures a soul, it regains 30 hp, and Reave Soul recharges at the start of its next turn. While a creature's soul is trapped, that creature can't be returned to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

A {@spell banishment} spell targeted at the greatsword forces the infernal knight to make a Charisma saving throw against the spell. On a failed save, any souls trapped in the blade are released instead of the spell's normal effect. Trapped souls are also released when the infernal knight dies.

action.name: Planar Rift (1/Day)
entries: The infernal knight magically tears a rift in the fabric of the multiverse. The rift is a portal to a plane of the infernal knight's choice. The portal remains open for 1 hour, during which time any creature can pass through it, moving from one plane to the other. A {@spell dispel magic} spell targeting the rift can destroy it if the caster succeeds on a {@dc 18} spellcasting ability check.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the wind's harp devil remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wind's harp devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Strong Winds
entries: The wind's harp devil has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is an air elemental, wind demon, or similar creature of air, is within 20 feet of the target, and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wind's harp devil makes two infernal noise attacks.

action.name: Infernal Noise
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Hellish Chorus {@recharge 5}
entries: The wind's harp devil creates an infernal cacophony. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Devils are immune to the hellish chorus.

reaction.name: Diabolical Countersong
entries: When a spell is cast within 60 feet of it, the wind's harp devil plays a single, infernal note, interrupting the spell. This reaction works like the counterspell spell, except it only works on spells of 3rd level or lower.

trait.name: Undead Resistance
entries: The dhampir has advantage on saving throws against disease.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dhampir makes two rapier or two shortbow attacks. It can make a grapple attack or Dark Thirst attack in place of any attack.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dark Thirst
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the dhampir, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. The dhampir regains hp equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Predatory Charm
entries: The dhampir magically beguiles the mind of one humanoid it can see within 30 feet for 1 hour. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or the dhampir has advantage on Charisma checks against the target. If the dhampir or any of its allies damage the target, the effect ends. If the target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends, the target is immune to this dhampir's Predatory Charm for the next 24 hours. A creature immune to being {@condition charmed} is immune to this effect. A dhampir can have only one target affected by its Predatory Charm at a time. If it uses its Predatory Charm on another target, the effect on the previous target ends.

trait.name: Inspiring Savagery
entries: Each ally within 30 feet of the dhampir that can see it can make one melee attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Undead Resistance
entries: The dhampir has advantage on saving throws against disease.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dhampir makes four rapier or four shortbow attacks. It can make a grapple attack or Dark Thirst attack in place of any attack.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dark Thirst
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the dhampir, incapactitated, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The dhampir commander regains hp equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Predatory Charm
entries: The dhampir magically beguiles the mind of one humanoid it can see within 30 feet for 1 hour. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or the dhampir has advantage on Charisma checks against the target. If the dhampir or any of its allies damage the target, the effect ends. If the target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends, the target is immune to this dhampir's Predatory Charm for the next 24 hours. A creature immune to being {@condition charmed} is immune to this effect. A dhampir can have only one target affected by its Predatory Charm at a time. If it uses its Predatory Charm on another target, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the dhampir can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the dhampir. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the dhampir is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The archaeopteryx doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archaeopteryx makes two attacks. one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Headbutt
entries: If the lystrosaurus moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the lystrosaurus can make one bite attack against it immediately as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The nodosaurus has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the dracotaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dracotaur makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws or two with its longbow.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Arrow (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dracotaur shoots an arrow at a point it can see within 150 feet where it explodes into a 20-foot-radius sphere of lightning. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as damage much on a successful one.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dracotaur exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Bound
entries: The dragon is magically bound to three circlets. As long as the dragon is within 1 mile of a circlet wearer on the same plane of existence, the wearer can communicate telepathically with the dragon. While the dragon is active, the wearers see through its eyes and hear what it hears. During this time, the wearers are deaf and blind with regard to their own senses.

If only two circlet wearers are within 1 mile of the active dragon, each hour spent wearing the circlets imposes one level of {@condition exhaustion} on those wearers. If only a single wearer is within 1 mile of the active dragon, each minute spent wearing the circlet gives that wearer one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If no circlet wearers are within 1 mile of the dragon, it views all creatures it can see as enemies and tries to destroy them until a circlet wearer communicates with the dragon or the dragon is destroyed. A circlet wearer can use its action to put the dragon in an inactive state where it becomes {@condition incapacitated} until a wearer uses an action to switch the dragon to active.
Each circlet is a magic item that must be attuned.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries: The dragon can use its Oil Spray. It then makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its fists.

action.name: Fist

action.name: Oil Spray
entries: The dragon sprays oil in a 30-foot-cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or become vulnerable to fire damage until the end of the dragon's next turn.

action.name: Tail Sweep
entries: The dragon swings its bladed tail. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i An orange glow burns in the eyes of an enormous mechanical dragon. Gears whir as the black-plated war machine spreads steel wings, spewing flames over a battalion of screaming knights.}
Clockwork dragons are siege machines fashioned after their namesake. The one-headed variety stands roughly twelve feet tall, while the three-headed dragon exceeds twenty.

entries.name: Weapons of War
entries: Only the most developed nations can afford to build clockwork dragons, but they are worth the cost. A single machine easily turns the tide of most battles and lasts decades. Their mace-tipped fists can breakdown any structure, while mechanical wings give them flight. The dragons' bladed tails kill enemies in a single sweep and a special oil cannon in their chest makes any target vulnerable to the dragon's fiery breath.

entries.name: Group Control
entries: A clockwork dragon is created and controlled by a team of three engineers that wear special circlets. While just one of these engineers can control a dragon for a short period of time, any sustained period of solo control is so taxing it kills the engineer. If all the engineers remove their headbands while the dragon is active, the construct attempts to massacre every creature it can see.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: A clockwork dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries: The dragon is magically bound to three circlets. If only a single wearer is within 1 mile of the active dragon, each minute spent wearing the circlet gives that wearer one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If no circlet wearers are within 1 mile of the dragon, it views all creatures it can see as enemies and tries to destroy them until a circlet wearer communicates with the dragon or the dragon is destroyed. A circlet wearer can use its action to put the dragon in an inactive state where it becomes {@condition incapacitated} until a wearer uses an action to switch the dragon to active.
Each circlet is a magic item that must be attuned.

entries.name: A Wasteland Dragon's Lair
entries: Wasteland dragons make their homes among the ruins of dead civilizations, often inside surviving structures vast enough to contain them and protect them from the elements. Old cisterns of sufficient size, auditoriums, or the audience chambers of forgotten nobles all make suitable lairs for a wasteland dragon. They are not above making their home in a cave, but it will likely be in close proximity to a ruined settlement of some size; wasteland dragons grow bored easily, and rummaging through ruins, either for curiosities or interlopers, takes up a good deal of their time.

A legendary wasteland dragon infuses its surroundings with traces of the magic it seeks to deny the outside world. It might hear the thoughts of trespassers as though they were carried on a breeze. Magic items and spells may behave unpredictably, becoming more powerful, functioning in a new way, or failing to function at all. Prolonged exposure to the environment near a wasteland dragon's lair may lead to mutations and even madness, though the latter often passes once the sufferer is taken from the area.

Clever creatures, wasteland dragons often make some use of the arcane items they find, seeing no hypocrisy in doing so; after all, they are hardly as foolish as humans! The approach to the creature's lair might be protected by strange energy fields, or weakened barriers between this world and another, or by creatures of the wastes who are smart enough to otherwise avoid annoying the dragon. The dragon confronted in its lair might forego its general inclination to attack immediately in favor of luring the intruders into such traps.

trait.name: Line of Battle
entries: When the dragonborn edjet is within 5 feet of two allies that aren't {@condition incapacitated}, it has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the dragonborn edjet can deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the edjet that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonborn edjet makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dragonborn edjet exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Elemental Focus
entries: Each dragonborn elementalist permanently aligns with a particular element. This elemental focus grants the dragonborn resistance to a certain damage type and the ability to innately cast some spells. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks).

items.name: Flame (Fire):
items.entry: The dragonborn has resistance to fire damage. It can cast the {@spell produce flame} cantrip at will and can cast {@spell heat metal} or {@spell scorching ray} three times per day.

items.name: Storm (Air):
items.entry: The dragonborn has resistance to lightning damage. It can cast the {@spell shocking grasp} cantrip at will and can cast {@spell blur} or {@spell gust of wind} three times per day.

items.name: Tide (Water):
items.entry: The dragonborn has resistance to cold damage. It can cast the {@spell ray of frost} cantrip at will and can cast {@spell sleet storm} or {@spell water breathing} three times per day.

items.name: Cave (Earth):
items.entry: The dragonborn has resistance to poison damage. It can cast the {@spell blade ward} cantrip at will and can cast {@spell meld into stone} or {@spell shatter} three times per day.

trait.name: War Mage
entries: When making an opportunity attack, the dragonborn can cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action instead of making a weapon attack. If this spell requires a ranged attack roll, the dragonborn doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources. This spell must only target the creature that provoked the opportunity attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragonborn makes two scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dragonborn breathes elemental energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage of the elementalist's elemental focus type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Cavalry Charge
entries: If the dragonborn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while mounted and then hits with a lance attack on the same turn, it can make a trample attack against that creature as a bonus action.

trait.name: Locked Saddle
entries: The dragonborn can't be knocked {@condition prone}, dismounted, or moved against its will while mounted.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: The dragonborn is rarely seen without its giant lizard mount. The lizard wears custom scale mail that raises its Armor Class to 15. While the dragonborn is mounted, the giant lizard can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage. Heavy Crossbow. Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trample (Mounted Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The dragonborn breathes fire in a 15-foot cone. All creatures in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Infantry Slayer
entries: While mounted, the dragonborn has advantage on melee weapon attacks against creatures that are Medium or smaller and are not mounted.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: While mounted, the dragonborn's mount can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Cavalry Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage. Shortbow. Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: rThe dragonborn breathes fire in a 15-foot cone. All creatures in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Devastate {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, the ouroban imbues its greatsword with dark power. All of its greatsword attacks do an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage per hit until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the ouroban is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hp equal to the fire damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ouroban makes three attacks with its greatsword.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The ouroban exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Abyssal Fires (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The ouroban summons green flames under up to five creatures within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.
The ouroban has advantage on attack rolls and ability checks against a creature {@condition poisoned} by its Abyssal Fires.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ouroban is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The ouroban has the following paladin spells prepared:

spells: {@spell divine favor} (fire damage instead of radiant)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bathhouse drake can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Soapy
entries: The bathhouse drake has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bathhouse drake makes three melee attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws. Alternatively, it can use Scalding Jet twice.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Scalding Jet
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Steam Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The bathhouse drake creates a burst of hot steam. Each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a success, a target takes half the damage but isn't {@condition blinded}. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bathhouse drake's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fey drake has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the fey drake can magically turn {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the drake wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fey drake makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

action.name: Bewildering Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The drake breaths a plume of purple gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed}, the creature can't take bonus actions or reactions, and it makes all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma skill checks and saving throws with disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fey drake's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Mighty Leap
entries: The drake's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet with or without a running start. Additionally, if it ends its jump within 5 feet of a creature, the first attack roll it makes against that creature before the end of its turn has advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The forest drake makes one bite attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The drake exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Curative Saliva
entries: The moon drake's saliva can be bottled, distilled, and used in 1-ounce doses. An afflicted lycanthrope that drinks this concoction is instantly cured of lycanthropy, requiring no saving throw. This draught can't cure a natural-born lycanthrope of the curse of lycanthropy.

trait.name: Moonbound
entries: A moon drake's power waxes and wanes with the moon. Under a full moon, it has resistance to bludgeoning, d rake, m oon piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks and its weapon attacks deal an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage. Under a new moon, it has vulnerability to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Under any other moon, it gains no extra traits.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The moon drake makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) radiant damage. A shapechanger that takes radiant damage from this attack instantly reverts to its true form and can't assume a different form for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Moonlight Nip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature afflicted with lycanthropy. {@h}The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cured of lycanthropy (it can willingly fail this save). This attack can't cure a natural born lycanthrope of the curse of lycanthropy.

action.name: Lunarbeam {@recharge 5}
entries: The drake exhales searing moonlight in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A shapechanger makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If it fails, it also instantly reverts to its true form and can't assume a different form for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

reaction.name: Form of Moonlight
entries: When the moon drake takes damage or is {@condition restrained}, it can transmute its physical form into an incorporeal form of pure moonlight until the end of its next turn. While in this form, it has resistance to cold, fire, and lightning damage and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. While in this form, the drake can pass through openings at least 1 inch wide and through transparent objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Binding Witness
entries: Creatures that make a pact or agree to terms while the drake witnesses the agreement are bound by the drake's magic. They have disadvantage on saving throws against scrying by the drake (simply making a successful save against the drake's scrying usually is enough to arouse its suspicion), and they become potential targets for the drake's Punish Transgressor action.

trait.name: Sense Falsehood
entries: The drake knows if it hears a lie.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pact drake makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Enforced Diplomacy {@recharge 5}
entries: The pact drake breathes a calming haze in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in the cone must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed}, a creature also can't attack up to five creatures of the pact drake's choice. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

action.name: Punish Transgressor
entries: The drake targets a single creature within 60 feet that broke the terms of a pact witnessed by the drake. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d6} minutes. The conditions can be ended early only with a {@spell dispel magic} ({@dc 15}) spell or similar magic. When these conditions end, the affected creature has disadvantage on saving throws until it finishes a long rest.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Pact's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only somantic components:

trait.name: Quill Regrowth
entries: The peluda has 24 large, spiny quills and dozens of smaller ones. It uses a large quill every time it makes a quill attack or a creature is successfully damaged by its Spiky Hide. Used quills regrow when it finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Spiky Hide
entries: A creature that touches the peluda or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Quill
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/80 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The peluda uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Steam Breath
items.entry: The drake exhales scalding steam in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Acid Breath
items.entry: The drake exhales acid in a 15-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The skull drake has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the skull drake has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skull drake makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Necrotic Breath {@recharge 6}
entries: The skull drake exhales a 15-foot cone of noxious, black gas. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hp by this damage dies.

trait.name: Sticky Secretions
entries: When the spider drake is hit with a melee attack, the attacker's weapon becomes stuck to the web fluid secreted from its scales. If the attacker didn't use a weapon, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} in the webbing. As an action, a creature can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, escaping or freeing its weapon from the secretions on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spider drake makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws. It can use Web in place of its bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The drake exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned}. On a success, a creature d rake, s Pider takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect also ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

trait.name: Bound Devotion
entries: The dream squire has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. If an effect would cause the squire to take a harmful action against its master, it can immediately repeat the saving throw (if any), ending the effect on a success. The squire has disadvantage on attack rolls or ability checks made against its master.

trait.name: Master's Bond
entries: The dream squire is bound to serve another creature as its master. The squire obeys all the master's commands, and the master can communicate telepathically with the squire as long as they are on the same plane.

A {@spell dispel evil and good} spell's break enchantment option that targets a dream squire forces it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the squire's bond with its master is broken, and it returns to its true form (use human {@creature guard} statistics).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dream squire makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: For the Master
entries: When the dream squire's master is targeted by an attack or spell, the squire magically teleports to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the master, and the attack or spell targets the squire instead. If the attack or spell deals damage, the dream squire takes half damage from it. To use this ability, the master and squire must be on the same plane.

trait.name: Create Wraith
entries: Any humanoid that dies at the hands of a dream wraith rises 1 hour later as a wraith under the dream wraith's control.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The dream wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the dream wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Sleep Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Steal Dreams
entries: The dream wraith targets an {@condition unconscious} or sleeping creature within 5 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be reduced to 0 hp. The dream wraith gains temporary hp for 1 hour equal to the amount of hp the creature lost.

reaction.name: Dreamer's Gaze
entries: When a creature the dream wraith can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the dream wraith, the dream wraith can create the illusion that it looks like that creature's most recently departed loved one. If the creature can see the dream wraith, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Alien Mind
entries: The dust goblin chieftain has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. In addition, it can use an action to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. This works like the detect thoughts spell, except it can only read surface thoughts and there is no limit to the duration. The dust goblin chieftain can end this effect as a bonus action or by using an action to change the target.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the dust goblin chieftain can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The dust goblin chieftain deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the dust goblin chieftain that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the chieftain doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Twisted
entries: When the dust goblin chieftain attacks a creature from hiding, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The dust goblin chieftain adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the chieftain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Divine Words
entries: In addition to Common, a dvarapala can speak one language associated with its patron deity. Abyssal (chaotic or neutral evil deities), Celestial (good deities), or Infernal (lawful evil deities). A dvarapala who serves a neutral deity knows a language that is most appropriate for service to its deity (such as Primordial for a neutral god of elementals or Sylvan for a neutral god of nature).

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The dvarapala has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dvarapala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. You Shall Not Pass! The dvarapala can make an opportunity attack when a hostile creature moves within its reach as well as when a hostile creature moves out of its reach. It gets one extra reaction that be used only for opportunity attacks.

action.name: Gada
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is Large or smaller it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the dvarapala.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sweeping Strike {@recharge 4}
entries: The dvarapala targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails its save is pushed 5 feet away from the dvarapala.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dvarapala's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Coagulate
entries: Each time the elemental takes cold damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Destroyed By Water
entries: If the blood elemental becomes entirely submerged in water, it dissipates and dies instantly.

trait.name: Liquid Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blood Drain {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and, if it is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). A {@condition grappled} creature is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe. If the saving throw is successful, the creature is pushed out of the elemental's space. The elemental can grapple one Large creature or up to two Medium or smaller creatures at one time.

At the start of the elemental's turn, each target {@condition grappled} by it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can use its action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check, freeing a {@condition grappled} creature on a success. When Blood Drain deals 30 or more necrotic damage, the elemental grows in size as though affected by an enlarge/reduce spell. This increase in size lasts until the blood elemental finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Tempest
entries: The storm lord is surrounded in a 120-foot-radius by a ferocious storm. The storm imposes disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks based on sight or hearing within the area. The storm lord's own senses and attacks are not impaired by this trait.
The tempest extinguishes open flames and disperses fog. A flying creature in the tempest must land at the end of its turn or fall.

Each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the storm lord must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the storm lord. Any creature within 30 feet of the storm lord must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to the storm lord.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The storm lord makes two slam attacks or two lightning bolt attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 7d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Lightning Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 7d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Thunder Clap {@recharge 5}
entries: The storm lord creates a peal of ear-splitting thunder. Each creature within 30 feet of the storm lord must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 54 ({@damage 12d8}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened}. On a success, a target takes half the damage but isn't {@condition deafened}. The deafness lasts until it is lifted by the {@spell lesser restoration} spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Liquid Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The elemental has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The venom elemental makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Alchemical Arrows
entries: As a bonus action, the archer attaches an alchemy tube to the shaft of one arrow before firing its longbow. On a successful hit, the alchemy tube shatters and does one of the following.

trait.name: Concussive
entries: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Entangling
entries: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage and is {@condition restrained} by sticky, alchemical goo. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, bursting through the goo on a success. The goo can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; immunity to piercing, slashing, poison, and psychic damage).

trait.name: Explosive
entries: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and catches on fire, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 16} Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The archer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the archer to sleep.

trait.name: Hunter's Aim
entries: Once per turn, when the archer makes a ranged attack with its longbow and hits, the target takes an extra 28 ({@damage 8d6}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alchemist archer makes three longbow attacks or two scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Archer's Step
entries: The deathsworn can use Disengage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Death Bolt (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action after firing an arrow, the deathsworn can imbue the arrow with magical power, causing it to trail green fire. The arrow deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The deathsworn has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the deathsworn to sleep.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The deathsworn has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The deathsworn's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Stealthy Traveler
entries: The deathsworn can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the deathsworn surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deathsworn makes two melee attacks or four ranged attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Volley {@recharge 5}
entries: The deathsworn shoots a rain of fiery arrows in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The enchanter has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the enchanter to sleep.

trait.name: Reach of the Fey
entries: When the enchanter casts an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, the enchanter can choose to target all creatures within 10 feet of the target instead.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Captivating Gaze
entries: The enchanter targets a creature within 30 feet of it who can see or hear the enchanter. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. The {@condition charmed} target's speed is reduced to 0, it is {@condition incapacitated}, and it must spend each round looking at the enchanter. While looking at the enchanter, the {@condition charmed} target is considered {@condition blinded} to other creatures not between it and the enchanter. The {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the {@condition charmed} target takes damage from one of the enchanter's allies, it has advantage on the next saving throw. The effect also ends if the creature can no longer see or hear the enchanter. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the enchanter's Captivating Gaze for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Beguiling Parry {@recharge 4}
entries: When a creature within 30 feet that the enchanter can see targets it with an attack, the enchanter can stop the attacker with a glance. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or immediately stop the attack. The attacker can't attack the enchanter again until the start of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The enchanter is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The enchanter has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: {@note * Enchantment spell of 1st level or higher}

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The servant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the servant to sleep.

trait.name: Inspire Artistry (3/Day)
entries: The servant of the vine selects up to 6 creatures within 50 feet and grants them advantage to Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}), Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}), or Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks. The servant of the vine chooses which skill for each recipient.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The servant makes three drunken slash attacks.

action.name: Drunken Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Stuporous Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The servant of the vine exhales potent fumes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and falls asleep, remaining {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage but doesn't fall asleep. The {@condition unconscious} target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. When the creature wakes, it is {@condition poisoned} until it finishes a short or long rest. The breath has no effect on constructs or undead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The servant of the vine is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The servant of the vine has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells: {@spell create or destroy water} (creates or destroys wine; wine created this way evaporates after 1 day)

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Shadow Traveler (5/Day)
entries: As a bonus action while in shadows, dim light, or darkness, the shadow fey disappears into the darkness and reappears in an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. A tendril of inky smoke appears at the origin and destination when it uses this trait.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: rWhile in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Traveler In Darkness
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ambassador uses its Withering Stare. It then makes three rapier attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Honeyed Words (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The silver-tongued shadow fey ambassador weaves together a string of highly persuasive and agreeable words. Each creature within 30 feet of the ambassador must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the ambassador, regarding it as a wise and trustworthy ally with the creature's best interests at heart. A {@condition charmed} target doesn't have to obey the ambassador's commands, but it views the ambassador's words in the most favorable way.

Each time a {@condition charmed} target witnesses the shadow fey ambassador or its allies do something harmful to the target or its companions, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts as long as the ambassador maintains concentration, up to 8 hours.

action.name: Withering Stare
entries: The shadow fey ambassador targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the ambassador's Withering Stare for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Obscure the Way (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the shadow fey designates a creature it can see within 100 feet and obscures the creature and its companions' travel on a particular shadow road. That shadow road will not open for the designated creature or its traveling companions except through powerful magical means such as by a key of Veles (see the "Fifth Edition Appendix" in the Midgard Worldbook). In addition, that shadow road won't lead to its usual destination for the designated creature or its traveling companions, instead leading the group in a meandering loop. This effect lasts for 9 ({@dice 2d8}) days, until the shadow fey removes the effect, or until the shadow fey dies.

trait.name: Shadow Traveler (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action while in shadows, dim light, or darkness, the shadow fey disappears into the darkness and reappears in an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. A tendril of inky smoke appears at the origin and destination when it uses this trait.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Traveler In Darkness
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight of the road makes two longsword attacks or two shortbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Shadow Traveler (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action while in shadows, dim light, or darkness, the shadow fey disappears into the darkness and reappears in an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. A tendril of inky smoke appears at the origin and destination when it uses this trait.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Traveler In Darkness
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.

trait.name: Group Actions
entries: When three pattern dancers are within 60 feet of each other,
they can work together to cast communal spells that are more
powerful than they could cast individually. To do this, one takes
an action to cast a spell, and the other two must use their
reactions to complete it. These spells are listed in innate spellcasting.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pattern dancer's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pattern dancer is a -level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The pattern dancer has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the shadow fey has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the poisoner scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Born of Shadows
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the shadow fey poisoner is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the shadow fey poisoner is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the poisoner instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Shadow Traveler (4/Day)
entries: As a bonus action while in shadows, dim light, or darkness, the shadow fey disappears into the darkness and reappears in an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. A tendril of inky smoke appears at the origin and destination when it uses this trait.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The shadow fey poisoner deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll; or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the poisoner, that ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and the poisoner doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Traveler In Darkness
entries: The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadow fey poisoner makes two shortsword attacks or two longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Ectoplasmic Spray
entries: When the elophar takes damage other than acid damage, corrosive ectoplasm bursts from its distended stomach. The elophar takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage and all creatures within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Possessed By Ancestors
entries: The chaos of combat causes an elophar to swap between personalities at the start of each of its turns. To determine which spirit is in control, roll on the table below (it is possible for one spirit to remain in control for multiple rounds if it is rolled multiple rounds in a row). See Spirit Control Table.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The elophar's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The toad can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Final Croak
entries: When the toad is reduced to 0 hp, it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Mad Hopping
entries: Ranged attacks against the toad have disadvantage.

trait.name: Selective Immunity
entries: When an attack or effect deals fire damage to the toad, the toad can choose to take the fire damage as if it were not immune.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The toad's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Death Leap
entries: The exploding toad can turn an attack that missed it into a hit or turn a successful saving throw into a failure.

trait.name: Trader
entries: The far wanderer understands the literal meaning of any spoken or written language it hears or reads. In addition, it can use an action to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. This works like the detect thoughts spell, except it can only read surface thoughts and there is no limit to the duration. It can end this effect as a bonus action or by using an action to change the target.

trait.name: Traveler
entries: As a bonus action, the far wanderer folds the fabric of reality to teleport itself to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. A brief shimmer of starlight appears at the origin and destination.

action.name: Stardust Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) slashing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Stardust bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Call to Yorama (1/Day)
entries: The far wanderer channels the energy of the living god-star Yorama. One creature the far wanderer can see within 60 feet must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails the saving throw is {@condition stunned} until the end of its turn. Alternately, the far wanderer can instead restore 14 ({@dice 4d6}) hp to one willing creature it can see within 60 feet.

monster.name: Fear Liath
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Gray Curse
entries: If {@spell remove curse} is cast upon a fear liath, it is instantly destroyed. In addition, if the fear liath kills a humanoid creature, the fear liath is destroyed and the humanoid it killed rises as a fear liath in {@dice 1d4} hours. If {@spell remove curse} is cast upon the cursed humanoid before it becomes a fear liath, the curse is broken.

trait.name: Unwatchable
entries: The fear liath becomes incorporeal and appears as a dark gray shadow while any living creature looks directly at it. While incorporeal, it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. While incorporeal, it also gains resistance to acid, fire, lightning, and thunder damage, and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. The fear liath has no control over this trait.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid looking directly at the fear liath at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the fear liath until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If a creature looks at the fear liath, the fear liath becomes incorporeal.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Fate Touched
entries: Berchta's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, she deals an extra {@damage 2d8} force damage (included in the attack). In addition, she adds her Wisdom modifier to her AC.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Berchta fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Berchta can use her action to polymorph into a Medium human woman, a Small swan, or back into her true form. Her statistics, other than her size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying transforms with her. Berchta reverts to her true form if she dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Berchta makes two attacks.
